kenticocommunity.qandaanswerdata.QAndAAnswerDataContent:
As per documentation:
[Macro expressions | Xperience by Kentico Documentation](https://docs.kentico.com/developers-and-admins/configuration/macro-expressions)
In the current version of Xperience by Kentico, macro expressions are usable in:
* the source code of [Email templates](https://docs.kentico.com/developers-and-admins/digital-marketing-setup/email-templates) * the **Modules** application when defining default values for the editing forms of [object types](https://docs.kentico.com/developers-and-admins/customization/object-types)
They aren't widely used or available in other areas I'm afraid. Instead, you may need to use the Form Widget Customizations to detect your "time" field and set a value in them as it renders.
Try using the below to register a FormFieldRenderingConfiguration.GetConfiguration.Execute, and in it check for your field (either by a specific TYPE of field or actual field name) and then in there you should be able to set the default value dynamically to the time.\ \ <https://docs.kentico.com/developers-and-admins/development/builders/form-builder/form-widget-customization#add-contextual-markup-to-form-fields>
